title: FYP Project
text:
PROJECT OVERVIEW

FinYouth - Social Finance App for the Youth
For my Final Year Project at Nanyang Polytechnic, I developed FinYouth, an innovative social application designed to bridge the gap between young adults and financial literacy. The app combines social networking features with insurance and financial planning tools, making personal finance more accessible and engaging for the youth demographic.

title: FYP Project
text:
THE PROBLEM

Financial literacy among young adults in Singapore remains a significant challenge. Many youths find traditional insurance and financial planning intimidating, confusing, or simply boring. They often delay important financial decisions until it‚Äôs too late, missing out on the benefits of early financial planning.
Research shows that young adults are more likely to engage with content through social platforms. This insight became the foundation for FinYouth‚Äîwhy not meet them where they already are?

title: FYP Project
text:
THE SOLUTION


Social Integration
Connect with friends to share financial goals, celebrate milestones, and learn from each other‚Äôs journeys. Financial planning becomes a community experience rather than a solo struggle.


Insurance Made Simple
Break down complex insurance products into bite-sized, easy-to-understand modules. Interactive calculators help users determine their coverage needs without the jargon.


Gamified Savings
Set savings goals, track progress, and earn achievements. Friendly competition with friends motivates consistent saving habits.


Financial Education
Curated content including articles, videos, and quizzes tailored for young adults. Learn about CPF, investments, budgeting, and more in an engaging format.

THE VISUALIZATION












Figure 1: Bitcoin (BTC) to USD price chart showing daily candlestick data. The visualization displays open, high, low, and close prices over time, with volume data shown below.

title: Data Visualization & Reflection
text:
WHAT IS BEING VISUALIZED

This interactive chart visualizes Bitcoin‚Äôs price movement against the US Dollar over time. The data is sourced from Bitstamp, one of the oldest cryptocurrency exchanges, ensuring reliable historical price data.

Quantitative Data Displayed:

Price (Y-axis): The USD value of one Bitcoin, ranging from historical lows to all-time highs
Time (X-axis): Chronological progression showing price evolution over days, weeks, months, or years
Candlesticks: Each candle represents a time period showing four key values:

Open: Price at the start of the period
Close: Price at the end of the period
High: Maximum price reached during the period
Low: Minimum price reached during the period

Volume: The amount of Bitcoin traded during each period, displayed as bars at the bottom

The color coding (green for upward movement, red for downward) provides immediate visual feedback on market sentiment and price direction.

title: Data Visualization & Reflection
text:
THE STORY BEHIND THIS


My Introduction to Crypto
My fascination with cryptocurrency began during my polytechnic years when Bitcoin first started making headlines. As someone passionate about technology, the concept of decentralized digital currency built on blockchain technology immediately captured my interest. It wasn‚Äôt just about the potential financial gains‚Äîit was about witnessing a technological revolution unfold in real-time.


Why Bitcoin Matters to Me
Bitcoin represents more than just a digital asset. It‚Äôs a paradigm shift in how we think about money, trust, and financial systems. As a Fintech student at SIT, understanding cryptocurrency and blockchain technology isn‚Äôt just a hobby‚Äîit‚Äôs essential knowledge for my future career. The intersection of finance and technology is exactly where I want to be.



I‚Äôve spent countless hours analyzing charts, understanding market cycles, and learning about the technology behind various cryptocurrencies. This visualization represents that journey‚Äîa visual representation of an asset class that has taught me about markets, volatility, risk management, and the importance of doing your own research.

title: Data Visualization & Reflection
text:
VISUALIZATION RATIONALE


Why Candlestick Charts?
Candlestick charts were chosen over simple line charts because they convey four data points per time period instead of just one. This provides a much richer understanding of price action, showing not just where the price ended, but the entire journey it took to get there. The visual pattern recognition possible with candlesticks is invaluable for understanding market behavior.


Why Include Volume?
Volume is the heartbeat of the market. Price movements accompanied by high volume are more significant than those with low volume. Including volume data adds another dimension to the analysis, helping distinguish between meaningful price movements and noise.


Why Dark Theme?
Beyond aesthetic preference, the dark theme reduces eye strain during extended chart analysis sessions. Most professional traders prefer dark interfaces, and it aligns with the overall gaming-inspired theme of this portfolio website.


Why Interactive?
Static images become outdated immediately. An interactive, real-time chart allows viewers to explore the data themselves‚Äîzooming into specific periods, changing timeframes, and examining exact values. This transforms passive viewing into active exploration.

title: Data Visualization & Reflection
text:
KEY INSIGHTS

Analyzing Bitcoin‚Äôs price history reveals several important patterns:

Cyclical Nature: Bitcoin follows roughly 4-year cycles, often correlated with its ‚Äúhalving‚Äù events where mining rewards are cut in half
Volatility: The dramatic price swings demonstrate both the opportunities and risks in cryptocurrency markets
Adoption Curve: The overall upward trend over longer timeframes reflects growing institutional and retail adoption
Market Psychology: The chart patterns reveal human emotions at play‚Äîfear, greed, euphoria, and capitulation

This visualization serves as a constant reminder that markets are ultimately driven by human behavior, and understanding that behavior is key to navigating financial markets successfully.
